name: Hubble
description: A minimal proof-of-concept of my dissertation project: a lightweight, unified knowledge-base management system built for user-extensibility and self-hosting, with privacy, security, and full data ownership at its core

name: Chimney
description: A fast and lightweight static file server based on Hyper and Tokio

name: Mirror
description: Go library for runtime type generation (existing and non-existing/dynamic types)

name: Robin
description: An experimental new(-ish) way to build type-safe full-stack web applications with Go

name: Dotenv
description: Load environment variables from .env (and other) files in Gleam

name: Crossbar
description: A tiny data validation library in pure Gleam

name: Phlo
description: A minimal and fast PHP framework for the modern web

name: Vanity
description: Vanity URL service for Go modules e.g. go.trulyao.dev/mirror

name: Migrant
description: In-code database migration tool for Gleam projects

name: Plunk.gleam
description: A library for sending emails and interacting with the Plunk API in Gleam

name: Falcon
description: A smoother way to send HTTP requests with an axios-like interface

name: Jsorm
description: A demo JSON explorer in Gleam and HTMX

name: Reda
description: Import, organise, share and read your books, articles, and other digital documents anytime, anywhere

name: Bazooka
description: Find and terminate processes on your machine from your browser

name: Jenzo
description: Generate meta images on the fly using HTML templates

name: Hitlist
description: Execute multiple commands with a single command

name: PHP Router
description: A composer package that brings Express-like routing to PHP with support for middleware, class-based callbacks, dynamic routes etc
